page.title: 12WETHERBY - CENSUS FEATURES
page.content: The 1981 Census indicated that in Wetherby town the population is mainly composed of adults (60%), with children (0-15) forming 23.6% and the aged (over 60) 16.4%. These figures give a Total Dependency Ratio of 66.7%. The Census provided evidence of male and female emigration in the 20-30 age range, a falling birth-rate and an ageing population. It also revealed major social divisions in the town. Simply it can be divided into two areas. A mainly middle-class area in the west and north with high levels of car owner- ship (97% of all households), owner- occupation (100%) and lower than average unemployment (2%). In the south-east is a largely working-class area with lower levels of car ownership (42%), owner-occupation (16%) and higher unemployment (11%).
